stitches of christmas block bag cal overview & what we ll learn in this 12 day crochet-along we ll make 12 small blocks learn 12 stitch ideas and then turn them into a cute bag made from two panels 3 blocks wide by 2 blocks tall this cal is designed for new crocheters we move slowly repeat a lot and build skills one small step at a time how the project is built you will crochet 12 blocks each block starts with a small foundation chain usually 17 each day uses a different stitch or stitch idea but we keep it simple and repeat row so your hands can learn the moves at the end we will o join the blocks into two panels front and back of the bag o add edging and a handle to each panel o seam the panels together to make the finished bag block size very important each finished block should measure about 4 5 to 5 inches square if your squares are much smaller or much larger than this they may not fit together well during the assembly stage troubleshooting block size if your squares are too small o try going up a hook size from the recommended hook listed on your yarn label o if the new square is the correct size this is your new main hook o choose a size larger and a size smaller for your other hooks if your squares are too big o try going down a hook size from the recommended hook listed on your yarn label o if the new square is the correct size this is your new main hook o choose a size larger and a size smaller for your other hooks a little difference is okay you can lightly block them to match but try to stay close to the 4 5 5-inch range pg 1 www hodgepodge-crochet com hook sizes for this project along the way we will also learn how hook size changes your fabric for this project you will use three hook sizes your main hook this is the hook that is recommended on your yarn label or the size you settle on after troubleshooting that gives you a 4 5 5 block one hook that is one size smaller one hook that is one size larger we ll use these three hooks on different blocks so you can feel the difference in drape and texture even when the yarn and stitch are the same later for each day s stitch notes where it will say clearly which hook to use use your main hook here or switch to your smaller hook or try this with your larger hook what we learn in each block days 1 3 basic stitch heights we start with the three main crochet
